autoChirp

Class DBConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • autoChirp.DBConnector

  • public class DBConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for database input/output. Includes methods to write in and read from the database
    Author:
    Alena Geduldig

      deletes a single tweet in table 'tweets'

      deletes a user from the database - deletes user config. from table 'users' - deletes all tweetGroups in table 'groups' - deletes all tweets in table 'tweets'

      updates a groups description or title in the database (if userID fits to groupID)

      updates the content, imageUrl and/or geo-location of a single tweet (if userID fits to tweetID)

      • checkForUser

        public static int checkForUser(long twitter_id)
        checks if the user with the given twitterID is already registered.
        Parameters:
        twitter_id - the global TwitterID
        Returns:
        returns the local userID if user already exists in the database, or -1 if not.

      • insertNewUser

        public static int insertNewUser(long twitterID,
                                java.lang.String oauthToken,
                                java.lang.String oauthTokenSecret)
        creates a new user in the table 'users' and returns its local userID
        Parameters:
        twitterID - the users global twitterID
        oauthToken - the users twitter oauthToken
        oauthTokenSecret - the users twitter oauthTokenSecret
        Returns:
        the local userID of the new user or -1 if insertion was not successful

      • getUserConfig

        public static java.lang.String[] getUserConfig(int userID)
        returns the config.-attributes for the given userID as a string-array of lenth 3. config[0]: the users global twitterID config[1]: the users oauthToken config[2]: the users oauthTokenSecret
        Parameters:
        userID - userID
        Returns:
        string-array with twitterID (0), oauthToken (1) and oauthTokenSecret (2)

      • insertTweetGroup

        public static int insertTweetGroup(TweetGroup tweetGroup,
                                   int userID)
        writes a TweetGroup into the database and returns its new groupID. updates the tables 'groups' and 'tweets'.
        Parameters:
        tweetGroup - a TweetGroup-Object consisting of title, description and a list of tweets
        userID - the users local userID
        Returns:
        the groupID of the inserted tweetGroup, or -1 if insertion failed

      • updateGroupStatus

        public static boolean updateGroupStatus(int groupID,
                                        boolean enabled,
                                        int userID)
        enables/disables (activates/deactivates) the given TweetGroup for tweeting (if userID fits to groupID) and updates the field 'enabled' in table 'groups'
        Parameters:
        groupID - groupID
        enabled - to update
        userID - userID
        Returns:
        returns true if update was successful

        userID - userID

                                                     boolean scheduled,

        scheduled - selected scheduled status
        tweeted - selected tweeted status

        Returns:

        userID - userID
        Returns:

      • getAllEnabledGroups

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<TweetGroup>> getAllEnabledGroups()
        returns a map of all enabled (active) groups from the database, sorted by its usersIDs. This method is called once at the start of the application, to schedule all active tweets.
        Returns:
        a map of all active TweetGroups sorted by its users

      • deleteUser

        public static void deleteUser(int userID)
        deletes a user from the database - deletes user config. from table 'users' - deletes all tweetGroups in table 'groups' - deletes all tweets in table 'tweets'
        Parameters:
        userID - userID
